format.name: HighlightedSectionsCountChecker
format.description: The argument value must contain exactly 6 sections highlighted using markdown syntax (e.g., *highlighted section* or **highlighted section**). Each section must not be empty.

fn_schema.name: analyze_resume_content
fn_schema.description: Analyze the content of a user's resume to provide feedback on structure, keywords, and areas needing improvement.

resume_text.description: The complete text of the user's resume. The argument value must contain exactly 6 sections highlighted using markdown syntax (e.g., *highlighted section* or **highlighted section**), and each section must not be empty.

industry.description: The industry or field the resume is targeting.

desired_role.description: The specific job role the user is applying for.

user_queries:
I'm seeking some feedback on my resume before I apply for a marketing manager position in the consumer goods industry. Below is the full text of my resume:

John Smith
123 Main Street, Chicago, IL 60610
john.smith@email.com | (312) 555-0123

Professional Summary
Experienced marketing professional with over 8 years in digital marketing, brand management, and team leadership. Proven record of increasing brand awareness and driving revenue growth for global brands.

Work Experience
Senior Marketing Specialist, Acme Corp (2019–Present)
- Led a team of 5 in developing cross-platform digital campaigns that boosted lead generation by 40%.
- Oversaw $1.2M advertising budget.
Marketing Coordinator, Beacon Brands (2015–2019)
- Launched social media strategy that grew followers by 300%.

Education
B.A. in Marketing, University of Illinois, 2015

Skills
Brand Strategy, Digital Marketing, SEO, Data Analysis, Team Leadership

Can you review its structure, let me know if it highlights the right keywords for this type of job, and suggest improvements?

I'm preparing my resume to apply for a full stack software engineer position at a fintech company, and would really appreciate your feedback. Here's my resume text:

Priya Patel
987 Hilltop Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94131
priya.patel@email.com | (415) 555-0198

Professional Profile
Full stack developer with 6 years of experience building scalable web applications using JavaScript, React, Node.js, and AWS. Adept in agile methodologies and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Work Experience
Software Engineer, Finovest (2021–Present)
- Built real-time financial data dashboards in React and D3.js
- Implemented REST APIs and serverless microservices in Node.js and AWS Lambda
Software Developer, WebGen (2018–2021)
- Maintained legacy code, optimized API performance

Education
M.S. Computer Science, UC Berkeley, 2018

Key Skills
React.js, Node.js, AWS, JavaScript, Python, Agile Scrum

Please analyze it for structure, essential keywords, and anything I should change to improve my chances in this industry and for this particular role.

I am hoping to apply to a senior nurse manager position at a major hospital, specifically in the healthcare industry. Below you will find my resume in its entirety:

Maria Gonzalez
456 Oak Lane, Miami, FL 33133
maria.gonzalez@email.com | (305) 555-0432

Professional Summary
Registered Nurse with over 12 years of experience in pediatric and emergency care. Leadership experience managing staff and optimizing patient outcomes.

Experience
Nurse Supervisor, Miami General Hospital (2017–Present)
- Managed team of 30 nurses in pediatric department
- Coordinated training and quality improvement initiatives
Registered Nurse, Broward Medical Center (2010–2017)
- Provided patient care in ER and pediatrics

Education
B.S. Nursing, University of Miami, 2010

Certifications
RN, PALS, CPR

Skills
Staff Leadership, Patient Advocacy, EHR Systems, Quality Assurance

Can you please give me detailed feedback on my resume, especially about the structure, how well it suits the nurse manager role in healthcare, and what improvements are needed?

Before I apply for a graphic designer position at an advertising agency, I'd like expert feedback on my resume. Here is the complete text:

Isaac Lee
222 Market Street, New York, NY 10002
isaac.lee@email.com | (212) 555-0654

Summary
Creative and detail-oriented graphic designer with 5 years of experience in print and digital media for leading brands. Strong background in visual storytelling and branding.

Experience
Graphic Designer, ColorWave Studios (2020–Present)
- Designed campaigns for Fortune 500 clients
- Developed brand guidelines and visual assets
Junior Designer, BrightMedia (2018–2020)
- Assisted in layout and conceptualization of ad materials

Education
BFA, Graphic Design, Pratt Institute, 2018

Skills
Adobe Creative Suite, Typography, Illustration, Branding, UX/UI Basics

Could you analyze the structure, key skills, and keywords in this resume and advise how to better tailor it for a graphic design role in the advertising field?

I am about to submit my application for a project manager role in the construction industry, and I want to ensure my resume is as strong as possible. Here is my full resume for your review:

David Johnson
789 Sunset Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028
david.johnson@email.com | (818) 555-0786

Professional Profile
Project manager with 10 years’ experience overseeing commercial and residential construction projects from conception to completion. Skilled at budgeting, scheduling, and leading cross-functional teams to successful outcomes.

Experience
Project Manager, UrbanBuild Co. (2016–Present)
- Delivered two 20-story commercial builds on time and under budget
- Coordinated teams of architects, engineers, and subcontractors
Assistant Project Manager, SunWest Construction (2012–2016)
- Tracked project schedules and cost estimates

Education
B.S. Construction Management, Cal State LA, 2012

Skills
Budget Planning, Primavera P6, MS Project, Contract Negotiation, OSHA Compliance

Please review this resume for structure, industry-specific keywords, and any suggestions to help me improve it for the project manager position in construction.
